reason: Fed Policy Shock: HAWKISH_PIVOT - The FOMC minutes released on February 18, 2026, revealed a surprise hawkish tilt. Officials adopted 'two-sided' guidance, signaling that interest rate hikes remain a possibility if inflation remains above the 2% target, effectively ending the market's expectation for immediate rate cuts.

payload.summary: The FOMC minutes released on February 18, 2026, revealed a surprise hawkish tilt. Officials adopted 'two-sided' guidance, signaling that interest rate hikes remain a possibility if inflation remains above the 2% target, effectively ending the market's expectation for immediate rate cuts.
payload.market_impact: The US Dollar Index (DXY) surged toward multi-year highs and Treasury yields climbed. Precious metals, including gold and silver, experienced significant sell-offs as traders adjusted to the 'higher for longer' outlook.

reason: Fed Policy Shock: HAWKISH_PIVOT - The release of the January FOMC minutes on February 18, 2026, revealed a 'hawkish pause' that caught markets off guard. The minutes indicated that several Fed officials are open to resuming interest rate hikes if inflation remains above the 2% target, shifting from a 'when-to-cut' narrative to a 'two-sided' risk assessment. This was compounded by ongoing market repricing following the nomination of Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell.

payload.summary: The release of the January FOMC minutes on February 18, 2026, revealed a 'hawkish pause' that caught markets off guard. The minutes indicated that several Fed officials are open to resuming interest rate hikes if inflation remains above the 2% target, shifting from a 'when-to-cut' narrative to a 'two-sided' risk assessment. This was compounded by ongoing market repricing following the nomination of Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell.
payload.market_impact: The US Dollar index rallied significantly, while precious metals experienced a severe crash, with gold falling nearly 18% over a two-day period. Treasury yields climbed as traders sharply reduced bets on a March rate cut.

payload.market_impact: Expected to strengthen the US Dollar (USD) while exerting significant downward pressure on gold, silver, and other commodities due to higher yield expectations.

payload.summary: The release of the January FOMC minutes on February 18, 2026, revealed an unexpected hawkish tilt, with several officials discussing potential interest rate hikes if inflation remains sticky. reason: Fed Policy Shock: HAWKISH_PIVOT - FOMC minutes from the January meeting, released on February 18, 2026, revealed a hawkish shift as several officials discussed the possibility of resuming interest-rate hikes if inflation remains sticky. This countered market expectations for continued rate cuts and follows the recent nomination of Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as Fed Chair.

payload.summary: FOMC minutes from the January meeting, released on February 18, 2026, revealed a hawkish shift as several officials discussed the possibility of resuming interest-rate hikes if inflation remains sticky. This countered market expectations for continued rate cuts and follows the recent nomination of Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as Fed Chair.
payload.market_impact: The surprise hawkish tone led to a significant surge in the USD and a sharp sell-off in commodities, with gold and silver prices dropping substantially (reportedly as much as 11% and 31% respectively in the aftermath) as Treasury yields climbed.

reason: Fed Policy Shock: HAWKISH_PIVOT - FOMC minutes from the January meeting, released on February 18, 2026, revealed a surprise hawkish tilt as several officials discussed the possibility of raising interest rates if inflation remains sticky. This move to 'two-sided' guidance caught markets off guard, shifting expectations away from a consistent rate-cut trajectory.

payload.summary: FOMC minutes from the January meeting, released on February 18, 2026, revealed a surprise hawkish tilt as several officials discussed the possibility of raising interest rates if inflation remains sticky. This move to 'two-sided' guidance caught markets off guard, shifting expectations away from a consistent rate-cut trajectory.
payload.market_impact: The U.S. Dollar (USD) firmed and Treasury yields climbed following the news, while commodities like gold and silver faced downward pressure or paused their recent rallies due to the 'higher for longer' policy outlook.
